divs: sighting detailsi work the 3rd shift (3am - noon est) at my firm. i was outside of my office building taking a smoke break around 5am. it's a clear night this morning and the stars and moon are quite visible. i was just smoking and my mind was just going over mundane things and then i don't know why, i just craned my head as far back as it could go and i saw a decent size ball\sphere\orb (not sure what to call it) of light flying pretty much right over me. for a split second i thought it was just a light on a plane but then i reaized the light wasn't attached to anything. it was just a ball of light moving through the sky. i couldn't tell you the altitude except it wasn't very high in the sky. this is raleigh, nc and all the buildings are kind of small and this thing wasn't very high in the sky above my office building. it's hard to describe the size but i would say that it looked like the size of a quarter held at arms distance, maybe a little larger. it was a solid white color and although that sounds plain, there was more to the color of the thing.wow, it's so hard to explain. it was just an intense, rich white light. the other thing that surprised me is that it made no sound. i mean it was completely silent. it was around 5 am, there was no one around, no traffic either. the night was so quiet except for the sounds of night (slight chirping, crickets, etc), and this thing was flying low in the sky, i could not believe i wasn't hearing any noise coming from it at all. it was truly bizarre. the other thing i noticed was it's speed. it was travelling fairly slow, kind of cruising for lack of a better work\description. it struck me as if the thing wasn't flying so much as "gliding." it for the most part was traveling in the same direction but kind of wobled to the left and to the right a little bit. it seemed like it was in complete control to say the least.again, it's so hard to explain what i saw, i've never seen anything like that before. finally the thing kind of picked up it's speed and zoomed off. more like swoshed off. it seemed to me that the thing covered a big distance in a short amount of time and then it was completely gone. the whole thing probably took 2-3 minutes but it felt longer than that for me. i have to say that the thing left me in awe. it was also kind of eerie initially. i remember looking around frantically to see if anyone was around so i could share the experience with and so it could be more real to me. i know that no one is going to believe i saw what i saw. although it was kind of eerie, it was very beautiful to me. i don't know how else to put it. in the end there's no way of knowing what i saw. i just know it wasn't a plane\helicopter\baloon\blimp\star\planet or shooting star. again, i don't know what it was, i just know what it wasn't. it was a beautiful experience and i count myself fortunate enough to have been at the right place and right time. i'm sure you get a lot more exciting reports than this one but i believe that if you experience something like this, it's our responsibility to report it. there is no doubt i experienced something amazing this morning and what that means just blows my mind. again, i wish there was someone around to share it with. if you happen to have any other reports in raleigh for today would it be possible to contact me? it would very much like to compare notes with anyone who might have seen it. it was so amazing i find it hard to believe i was the only one. i apologize for writing so incoherently, my mind is still in shock over this and i felt it would be better to get everything out as fast as possible so i wouln't forget any details. again, thank you. sv in raleigh nc.
